conclusion: Analyze the path of light rays entering and exiting the semicircular glass brick.
The semicircular glass brick has a radius R and light rays strike the flat base at an angle π - γ.
Light rays refract according to Snell's Law when entering the glass brick.
The angle of incidence at the flat base is π - γ.
The angle of refraction inside the glass brick is found using Snell's Law.
Critical angle γ is the angle of incidence for total internal reflection.
For total internal reflection, the angle of incidence inside the glass must be ≥ γ.
Light rays travel through the semicircular glass brick and exit through the base.
Rays tangent to the curved surface graze and exit through the base.
Width of the base portion is determined by exit points of light rays.
Rays tangent to the curved surface exit where the angle of incidence is γ.
Width of the base is the chord length of the semicircle at angle γ.
Chord length L is calculated as 2R sin(γ).
The width of the portion of the base through which light passes is 2R sin(γ).
